body:
Encountered the same thing today.
Any news on this?

EDIT:
It's `mysql` / `@0.2.16` in my case.

issue.title: Fix query builder crashing when using object in .where inside Brackets

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
This is an attempt at fixing #3685 where the following piece of code

```typescript
const generatedSql = entityManager
    .createQueryBuilder()
    .from(Product, 'Product')
    .where(new Brackets(qb => qb.where({ id: 1 })))
```

would crash because the QueryBuilder could not determine the alias to use for `id`

issue.title: fix: Cannot read property 'hasMetadata' of undefined

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

body: @Kononnable people keep using `.where({ ... })` syntax when its supposed to be internal functionality used by ORM itself and thus have some bugs. We'll need to figure out query builder refactoring to prevent this unintended usage.

issue.title: Cannot read property 'hasMetadata' of undefined

repository.name: dives-backend
repository.description: Backend for expense tracker. Written using Serverless Framework, Apollo Server, AWS Lambda and PostgreSQL

issue.body:
When trying to update a budget (or other entities) I receive such error. Updating works only for the data that is sent in the first request after server start
```
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "message": "Cannot read property 'hasMetadata' of undefined",
      "locations": [
        {
          "line": 2,
          "column": 3
        }
      ],
      "path": [
        "updateBudget"
      ],
      "extensions": {
        "code": "INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR",
        "exception": {
          "stacktrace": [
            "TypeError: Cannot read property 'hasMetadata' of undefined",
            "    at UpdateQueryBuilder.whereEntity (/backend/src/query-builder/UpdateQueryBuilder.ts:353:44)",
            "    at SubjectExecutor.<anonymous> (/backend/src/persistence/SubjectExecutor.ts:425:40)",
            "    at step (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:141:27)",
            "    at Object.next (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:122:57)",
            "    at /backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:115:75",
            "    at new Promise (<anonymous>)",
            "    at Object.__awaiter (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:111:16)",
            "    at /backend/src/persistence/SubjectExecutor.ts:384:64",
            "    at Array.map (<anonymous>)",
            "    at SubjectExecutor.<anonymous> (/backend/src/persistence/SubjectExecutor.ts:384:47)",
            "    at step (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:141:27)",
            "    at Object.next (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:122:57)",
            "    at /backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:115:75",
            "    at new Promise (<anonymous>)",
            "    at Object.__awaiter (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:111:16)",
            "    at SubjectExecutor.executeUpdateOperations (/backend/node_modules/typeorm/persistence/SubjectExecutor.js:379:24)",
            "    at SubjectExecutor.<anonymous> (/backend/src/persistence/SubjectExecutor.ts:142:20)",
            "    at step (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:141:27)",
            "    at Object.next (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:122:57)",
            "    at fulfilled (/backend/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:112:62)",
            "    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:93:5)"
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "data": null
}
```

body:
> @Kononnable people keep using `.where({ ... })` syntax when its supposed to be internal functionality used by ORM itself and thus have some bugs. We'll need to figure out query builder refactoring to prevent this unintended usage.

...and what's the intended usage?

> @Kononnable people keep using `.where({ ... })` syntax when its supposed to be internal functionality used by ORM itself and thus have some bugs. We'll need to figure out query builder refactoring to prevent this unintended usage.

Is this still true? Is there a place in the documentation where this is clearly stated?

I see that the preferred one in the docs is
```ts
.where('id = :id', {id});
```
but I've never seen that `.where({ ... })` is not intended to be used.
